profileAlternative.name: Saman Armal
profileAlternative.headline: Data Scientist
profileAlternative.summary:
Passionate Data scientist, proficient in computational statistics and data analysis with demonstrated experience in climate and water-related disciplines. Skilled in data mining, visualizing, and machine learning, predictive models, diagnostic analysis, pattern recognition, and handling data-intensive applications with parallel/distributed computing systems. I'm currently finishing my Ph.D. in the field of Hydrology and Water Resources Science. My doctoral research focuses on developing a climate-informed stochastic weather generator to retain the spatial dependency of weather stations and address the non-stationary in data.

Analytics: R (dplyr, tidyr, ggplot2, ggmap, zoo, caret, glmnet, Rjags, etc.), Python (Anaconda, NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.), Keras/Tensorflow, MATLAB, SQL, Fortran.

Algorithms: Regression (Linear Regression and regularized forms), Bayesian hierarchical model (MCMC), Classification (Logistic Regression, kNN, SVMs, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting), Unsupervised Learning (PCA, Clustering), Time Series Analysis, Deep Learning (CNNs).

items: Understanding the Space-Varying Trends in Global Extreme Precipitation
Anomalies in the US Precipitation Extremes and Their Association with Different Modes of Climate Variability

An urban flood inundation model based on cellular automata

Water Resources/Coastal Engineer at Moffatt & Nichol
